critique: This document pertains to the assignment of specialists and technicians from the Departments of Commerce and Agriculture to temporary service abroad under the direction of the Secretary of State. It outlines the conditions and responsibilities of these officers, ensuring they are integrated into the Foreign Service during their assignments. There is no clear indication of ideological bias, immigration policy impact, or significant changes to executive power or federalism. The document primarily focuses on administrative procedure and inter-departmental coordination. Therefore, most scores should be neutral. There's a slight leaning towards federal control as it centralizes the assignment process through the Secretary of State.
